info.title: Daedalus-Core
info.description:
Daedalus Poject Core API specification.

# Introduction

This specification is intended to to be a good starting point for describing
this API, offering developers examples for working with it.

post.description: Admin users are allowed to add roles to its organizations groups

value.message: Selected role has been added to organization group.

400.description: Invalid requests, if user does not belong to required organization API response has 400 code.

value.message: No group_name provided. No role_name provided.
Required role is already assigned to this group.
Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

post.description: Admin users are allowed to add users to its organizations

200.description: User has been added to organization

400.description: Failed requests, if admin user does not belong to required organization it will receive 400 response.

value.message: There is no registered user with that token.

403.description: Non admin users of given organization are not allowed to add users to its organizations

value.message: Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

post.description: Admin users are allowed to add users to its organizations groups

value.message: Required user has been added to organization group.

400.description: Invalid Response, required data is invalid.

value.message: No group_token provided. No user_token provided.
There is no registered user with that token.
Required user is already assigned to this group.
Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

post.description: Admin users are allowed to create organizations

403.description: Non admin users are not allowed to create organizations

enum: You are not an admin user.

value.message: You are not an admin user.

post.description: Admin users are allowed to create organization groups

403.description: Only admins are allowed to create groups

value.message: Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

delete.description: Admin users are allowed to remove entire organization groups

value.message: Selected group has been removed from organization.
Cannot remove this group, no more admin users will left in this organization.
Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

delete.description: Admin users are allowed remove roles from organization groups, if this action left no admins inside an organization it cannot be done.

value.message: Selected role has been removed from organization group.
Required role is not assigned to this group.
Cannot remove this role, no more admin roles will left in this organization.

403.description: If organization user is not admin of that organization it receives the following response.

value.message: Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

delete.description: Admin users are allowed remove users from its groups

value.message: Required user has been removed from organization group.
Required user does not belong to this group.
There is no registered user with that token.
Cannot remove this user, no more admin users will left in this organization.
Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

get.description: Users are allowed to show their organizations.

400.description: There is a problem with session token

get.description: Admin users are allowed to see all organization groups

400.description: If user does not belong to required organization, API response does not return if organization_token exists or not.

403.description: If user belongs to required organization API response is forbidden.

value.message: Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

400.description: If user provides an invalid organization token or an organization token of organization where user does not bellow return code is 400

get.description: Users are allowed to list its organization groups.
Admin users are allowed to see its organization users

value.message: Your organization roles does not match with the following roles: organization master.

200.description: If API is working it returns "pong"

post.description: Registered users must activate their account.

200.description: Correct response, auth and correct password are provided

value.message: Valid Auth Token found, enter your new password.

400.description: Examples of failed requests because users did not provide their session token or their session token has expired.

403.description: Examples of failed requests because users are not admin ones.

enum: You are not an admin user.

value.message: You are not an admin user.

post.description: Users are allowed to log in into Daedalus Core

200.description: If login success, return user data and session token, superadmin users receive _hidden_data.

value.message: No e-mail provided. No password provided.
e-mail is invalid. No password provided.

post.description: Admin users are allowed to register new users

value.message: There already exists a user using this e-mail.

enum: You are not an admin user.

value.message: You are not an admin user.

get.description: Admin users are allowed to see its active registered users

enum: You are not an admin user.

value.message: You are not an admin user.

get.description: Admin users are allowed its registered user who has not activated their accounts

enum: You are not an admin user.

value.message: You are not an admin user.

get.description: Admin users are allowed to see registers users without any organization

value.message: You are not an admin user.

get.description: Admin users are allowed to see their registered users.

value.message: You are not an admin user.

ExpiresAfter.description: date in UTC when token expires

token_security.description: Once logged, users have to provide their session token for each request. As API uses http_basic for getting user token `Username` field is `session_token` and `password` should be a valid session token.
